Posts.Content: I went to talk to a Robotic Surgeon, he had me get a MRI before he would advise me on whether to have surgery or stay on WW. He said basing MRI on a 1-10 score, it was a 1 and told me if I was his Dad, he would delay surgery and feel comfortable to stay on WW. I told him I had a biopsy coming up at the V.A. in a few months. He said it can't hurt to get the biopsy. Went for biopsy last Thursday. At biopsy Dr. told me PSA went from 3.0(as of last PSA) to 4.6 while on Finasteride, which shouldn't happen. Wait another week for results. If readings are worse than last year's biopsy, guess I'll be contacting Robotic surgeon again and get the prostate out. Bottom line MRI showed nothing to worry about a few months ago, and now PSA reading possibly showing a need to take action now ????? ( V.A. uro doc wasn't impressed that I went for MRI on my own )
Posts.Signature: D.O.B.- 12/08/1949 V.A. hospital(Columbia,SC) PSA: 04/21/15 (7.16), 8/11/15(5.24) Biopsy 8/21/15- 2/12 cores positive, 1st core 80% involved 3+3(Gleason 6) 2nd core 30% involved 3+3(Gleason 6). PSA: 12/09/15 9.54, 3/10/16 3.74, 6/16 3.0 9/16 4.62. 2nd. biopsy 10/16-1 core positive(30%) Gleason score 6 still, PSA 1/24 2.69

Posts.Title: Stay on WW or Opt for Surgery?

Posts.Content: Called VA today to cancel 4/25 surgery, because chief UroDoc would be on medical leave and someone else would do surgery. I wasn't comfortable with that. I have been looking outside VA in this area for another UroDoc. I Found one that's got a lot of experience with DaVinci Robotic. When I talked to VA today, I was told my UroDoc is suppose to be back by end of March now. VA here only does Open surgery, but my Urologist has a lot of surgeries on his belt. I now have to decide on staying with my surgeon, or the other. I know it's my decision, but need help deciding. Are there any members here that had Open surgery and regret it ? Or can give me Pros and Cons of either one ? Thank You in advance.

Posts.Title: Thought I had a plan followup 2/13/16

Posts.Content: Well I had my last blood work before surgery 3/10. I saw my Urodoc today for results. He had me taking Finasteride after last PSA on 12/09. So he told me PSA went from 9.54(12/09) to 3.70 today. Asked me if I still wanted RP on 4/25, after I get back from Aruba trip. I decided on going back on A.S., because of the drop. Has me on a every 3 month PSA check again. I'm hoping I made right decision. My wife isn't thrilled, but I told her I have to deal with the E.D and incontinence issues after surgery. She just doesn't want to deal with me, walking around with Cancer.

Posts.Title: Just Received Diagnosis Active Sur Route I Think

Posts.Content: Hi all, Thought I was all set for RP on 4/25. RIGHTTT !! V.A. sent me letter to reschedule 3/10 PSA and counsel. I called and was told my Uro was going on medical leave ??? I was told I could come in 4/19 for PSA and counsel. I said I'll be in Aruba then. How about 4/22 ? Was told I could get blood drawn at 6am, see anesthesiologist at 9am and Uro at 9:30. Still have RP the 25th. I said I thought Uro was out on medical leave ? He is , you'll get a different surgeon. I said I never even met the doc, I don't think so. I'm not trusting my morbidity to a stranger. I can't believe they thought I would be ok with that. So now I have to see a Humana in network primary doc to get referral to a Uro. Guess only good thing may be that V.A. only did open RP and Uro doc's on the outside round here do Robotic. Maybe it's a Godsend. Stay tuned......

Posts.Title: Just Received Diagnosis Active Sur Route I Think

Posts.Content: Am responding to Highlander and Jim. In response to head spinning and why I haven't done anything yet. When my VA urologist told me my PSA went to 9.54, he told me I should think about treatment. After reading benefits of Robotic, I started searching for a Robotic surgeon. Meanwhile my VA urodoc put me on Finasteride to keep prostate from enlarging till I got back from vacation. When I got back, I finally found Robotic surgeon that was approved by Humana Ins( A real PITA ). I had two follow up PSA's that showed my PSA dropping ( 2nd one showed 3.0). VA doc said that's a good sign and I could stay on AS. I went to Robotic surgeon and he said he wouldn't advise me either way without 3T MRI ( He was surprised nobody suggested me getting one before ). Got MRI results and he said no sings of spreading outside prostate and vary low grade. He suggested staying on AS, because at my age(66) I have NO issues with ED or incontinence. He said a high % of issues after operation, depending on individual. I told him I had a biopsy coming up at VA and he said would be good idea to have it done. He said if I need him further, he's there for for me. Robotic surgeon is first surgeon in S.C. to do operation. Has great reviews. Had biopsy (12 cores, that's all they do) done last Thursday and go back to VA for results on the 21st. I mentioned the MRI that I had done and he really didn't seem impressed. He told me day of biopsy, that my PSA went up to 4.6 which is not good since I'm on Finasteride. I'll see what the results are. If results show cancer got worse. I'll call Robotic doc and make appointment for surgery. The other thing that I think about is statistics of cancer survival after treatment or not doing anything. From what I've seen chances are ya don't live any longer, either way. So live with cancer and still have sex and no dripping, or get rid of it and no sex and dripping( ain't getting injections to get hard either). Now MY head is spinning and Thanks guys for listening !!!!! John
Posts.Signature: D.O.B.- 12/08/1949 V.A. hospital(Columbia,SC) PSA: 04/21/15 (7.16), 8/11/15(5.24) Biopsy 8/21/15- 2/12 cores positive, 1st core 80% involved 3+3(Gleason 6) 2nd core 30% involved 3+3(Gleason 6). Posts.Title: To treat or not

Posts.Content: Highlander, Did your Dad have any issues with E.D. or incontinence after surgery ? The VA in Columbia, SC only does Open surgery, which I already told VA urologist I don't want. Why if I have it done, am going down to Charleston( non VA hospital) for Robotic. End up paying more out of pocket, but quicker recovery, less blood loss and less chance of infection. At least that's what I've heard. John

Posts.Content: So glad to hear you caught it in time Sarg !!!! My Dad went through that too. Was no walk in the park, but after recovery time he was back out golfing and bowling on two leagues. Here's to your speedy and complete recovery.
Posts.Title: Health

Posts.Content: So glad to hear you caught it in time Sarg !!!! My Dad went through that too. Was no walk in the park, but after recovery time he was back out golfing and bowling on two leagues. Here's to your speedy and complete recovery.
Posts.Title: Health

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I Was diagnosed with a low risk cancer 10/15. 4.7 psa, 2/12 cores, T1c, gls 6. Decided on AS at that time. Went for a follow up psa 12/15, 9.7. I'm with VA hospital in Columbia ,SC. Chief urologist said because of sharp increase I should consider a treatment. I've been researching treatments and just want it out of me. I told him I decided on RP. With VA schedule, he said end of 03/16 would be the earliest he could do it. I already had a trip planned ( 2nd real vacation) for my wife and I of 43 yrs prior to this. I ran that by him and he has me scheduled for surgery end of 04/16. Told me to enjoy trip, but don't pack on the pounds. I just wanted to have a great time on trip with my wife, not knowing out come of this cancer. After reading about AS (WW) thought would not make any difference with the delay. Now I've been reading it's best to get treatment ASAP. How long have you waited for any treatment after biopsy ? I have a follow up psa beginning of March. John
Posts.Title: Surgery wait time

Posts.Content: Thanks for replys. Ron my wife has put up a lot with me over the years, LoL. My PSA was less than 4, till recently. Am hoping the 9+ reading was a fluke, will find out in March. Will try and find out about MRI, but not sure if y'all are familiar with how VA system works. Wait and response time. The trip planned is to Aruba, bought and paid for. Have travel insurance but not sure if I start all over at another Urologist/ hospital ,would be any further ahead time wise. Guess will just have to hope, I didn't make wrong decision. Will keep y'all posted. Thanks again. Semper Fi....
